(3) OAI Wants You!

(4) What OAI Wants

  • Adopt open standards in your organization
  • Champion open standards within your organization
  • Provide feedback how OAI can improve their standards
  • Start participating in OAI's technical work
  • Become an OAI member

(6) WIIFM: Everybody's Favorite Station



OpenAPI User Stories Erik Wilde, OAI Ambassador: OAI Track Introduction and the State of OpenAPI

(7) WIIFM: Business and Organization Value

As business or organization leader
I want well-defined and usable digital interfaces for partners and the public
so that I can more easily change and scale my value streams.


OpenAPI User Stories Erik Wilde, OAI Ambassador: OAI Track Introduction and the State of OpenAPI

(8) WIIFM: API Developers

As an API developer
I want to describe the product I am going to implement
so that I can use various tools throughout the API lifecycle.


OpenAPI User Stories Erik Wilde, OAI Ambassador: OAI Track Introduction and the State of OpenAPI

(9) WIIFM: API Consumers

As an API consumer
I want APIs to have standardized descriptions
so that I can easily understand and consume the products I am accessing.


OpenAPI User Stories Erik Wilde, OAI Ambassador: OAI Track Introduction and the State of OpenAPI

(10) WIIFM: Platform People

As an API platform person
I want to support standardized description formats
so that all producers and consumers speak in the same language.


OpenAPI User Stories Erik Wilde, OAI Ambassador: OAI Track Introduction and the State of OpenAPI

(11) The (Open)API Lifecycle

Source: WSO2: What is Full Lifecycle API Management?

(13) OAI Participation

  • Follow OAI to learn about updates and new work
    • open-api-initiative [https://www.linkedin.com/company/open-api-initiative] on LinkedIn
    • @OpenApi [https://www.youtube.com/@OpenApi] on YouTube
  • Participate in working groups [https://www.openapis.org/participate/how-to-contribute] for technical questions and contributions
  • Become a member [https://www.openapis.org/membership/join] to support the effort and benefit from member perks


The OpenAPI Initiative (OAI) Erik Wilde, OAI Ambassador: OAI Track Introduction and the State of OpenAPI

(14) OAI Members



The OpenAPI Initiative (OAI) Erik Wilde, OAI Ambassador: OAI Track Introduction and the State of OpenAPI

(15) OAI Membership

  • Member fees are based on company size
  • Members have no special influence on technical decisions
  • Members get to decide how OAI allocates and spends funds
  • Members pay reduced fees at OAI-organized events

OpenAPI Versions Erik Wilde, OAI Ambassador: OAI Track Introduction and the State of OpenAPI

(17) OpenAPI Terminology

  • OpenAPI Specification (OAS) [https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.1.1.html#introduction]
    • The OpenAPI specification itself
    • Specifically: Not a description of an API with OpenAPI
  • OpenAPI Description (OAD) [https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.1.1.html#openapi-description]
    • The description of an API with OpenAPI
    • Descriptions can be spread across multiple documents
  • OpenAPI Document [https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.1.1.html#openapi-document]
    • One specific document of an OAD
    • OAD can be self-contained or may use multiple OpenAPI documents


OpenAPI Versions Erik Wilde, OAI Ambassador: OAI Track Introduction and the State of OpenAPI

(18) OpenAPI 2.0 [https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v2.0.html]

  • Released September 8, 2014
  • The same as Swagger 2.0 but renamed when the spec was donated


OpenAPI Versions Erik Wilde, OAI Ambassador: OAI Track Introduction and the State of OpenAPI

(19) OpenAPI 3.0 [https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.0.3.html]

  • Latest version is 3.0.3
    • Version 3.0.0 released July 26, 2017
    • Version 3.0.3 released February 20, 2020
    • 3.0.4 will be published very soon
  • Introduced the components section for reusable definitions
  • Changes to the handling of parametrized URLs
  • Changes to the handling of media types and content negotiation


OpenAPI Versions Erik Wilde, OAI Ambassador: OAI Track Introduction and the State of OpenAPI

(20) OpenAPI 3.1 [https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.1.0.html]

  • Released February 15, 2021
    • 3.1.1 will be published very soon
  • Alignment with the most recent version of JSON Schema
  • Support for webhooks (in addition to callbacks)

(22) Join the OAI/OpenAPI Community!

  • Join the community: github.com/OAI/community [https://github.com/OAI/community]
  • All technical and special interest groups meetings: openapis.org/calendar [https://www.openapis.org/calendar]
  • Upcoming events (including OAI Tracks): openapis.org/events [https://www.openapis.org/events]
